result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott E. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other supervision defendant is now serving

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or anytime he does not meet that requirement defendant to perform 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with B.M. unless approved by PO.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott E. Miller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Scott E. Miller
Current: 527 Ross Ave, Schofield, WI 54476 United States  (Effective: 03-11-2016)
Prior: 1407 N. Peach Avenue Lot #16, Marshfield, WI 54449

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 1:52pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person and with Atty Anne Renc.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW


PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling/Repeater)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 1 year probation, concurrent with any other supervision defendant is now serving.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; N/C with victim B.M. unless as approved by PO; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or any time he does not meet that requirement, defendant to perform 10 hours of community service per week; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.

Adj: 2:00pm

No contact with B.M. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
